steps.title: Lay the pattern
steps.content: Lay the pattern you want to make before you. Learn and understand how to read it. It will always have an even number of horizontal rows.

steps.title: Read the first vertical row zig-zag.
steps.content: Read the first vertical row zig-zag. Refer to the picture for a visual reference. The first row is the one numbered in light blue.

steps.title: Pick up the first beads
steps.content: Pick up the first beads of the correct colours and thread them on your thread (the light blue ones numbered as 1 to 10 in the picture).

steps.title: Read the second vertical row as numbered in the picture (the black beads numbered as 11 to 15 in the picture).
steps.content: Read the second vertical row as numbered in the picture (the black beads numbered as 11 to 15 in the picture).

steps.title: Pick up the first bead of the second row
steps.content: Pick up the first bead of the second row and add it to your string of beads hanging on the thread.

steps.title: Push your needle back through the third bead from the top.
steps.content: Push your needle back through the third bead from the top.

steps.title: Pull it tight
steps.content: Pull it tight so that the last bead of the first row and the first bead of the second row are centered horizontally on top of the other bead.

steps.title: Add the second bead
steps.content: Add the second bead from the second row to your thread.

steps.title: Push the needle through bead number four from the top.
steps.content: Push the needle through bead number four from the top. Continue this pattern until you have finished the second row (next you will push your needle back through the sixth bead, then the eighth, and then the tenth).

steps.title: Start the third vertical row
steps.content: Start the third vertical row in exactly the same way, but now reading from the bottom of your pattern to the top (you will now read the purple beads numbered from 21 to 25 in the picture).

steps.title: Continue in this fashion
steps.content: Continue in this fashion until you have finished your entire pattern.

steps.title: Work the thread back through your beaded mat
steps.content: Work the thread back through your beaded mat in a zig-zag way to finish off. Cut the thread off after you have reversed it.
